com.comfortanalytics.aon

Interface Awriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Aconstants, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonWriter

    public interface Awriter
extends Aconstants, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    An Aobj encoder that can be used to encode large graphs with or without Aobj instances.

    The following two examples achieve the same result.

    • out.value(new Amap().put("a",1).put("b",2).put("c",3));
    • out.newMap().key("a").value(1).key("b").value(2).key("c").value(3).endMap();

    Be aware that if the underlying encoding (such as JSON) doesn't provide a mechanism to differentiate between data types (such as numbers), values might not decode as the same type they were encoded.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.comfortanalytics.aon.Aconstants

        DBL_NAN, DBL_NEG_INF, DBL_POS_INF

        Awriter key(java.lang.CharSequence key)

      • value

        Awriter value(Aobj arg)
        Write a value to the map or list. If in a map, this must have been preceeded by a call to key(String). This can be used to encode an entire graph.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when improperly called.
